SYNTAX_PRINT_STATEMENT.description: print statement without parentheses (Py2 syntax removed in Py3)
SYNTAX_PRINT_STATEMENT.fix_strategy: Convert to print() function call; handle trailing comma as end='' parameter

SYNTAX_PRINT_CHEVRON.description: print >>file syntax for redirecting print output
SYNTAX_PRINT_CHEVRON.fix_strategy: Convert to print(..., file=sys.stderr) or print(..., file=f)

SYNTAX_EXCEPT_COMMA.description: except ExceptionType, variable: (comma syntax instead of 'as')
SYNTAX_EXCEPT_COMMA.fix_strategy: Replace comma with 'as' keyword: except ExceptionType as variable:

SYNTAX_RAISE_TWO_ARG.description: raise Type, value[, traceback] two/three-arg raise syntax
SYNTAX_RAISE_TWO_ARG.fix_strategy: Convert to raise Type(value) or raise Type(value).with_traceback(tb)

SYNTAX_EXEC_STATEMENT.fix_strategy: Convert to exec() function call: exec(code, namespace)

SYNTAX_LONG_LITERAL.description: 123L long integer literal suffix (removed in Py3, int/long unified)
SYNTAX_LONG_LITERAL.fix_strategy: Remove the L suffix; Python 3 int handles arbitrary precision

SEMANTIC_METACLASS_ATTR.fix_strategy: Move to class declaration: class Foo(metaclass=Meta):

SEMANTIC_CMP.description: __cmp__ method, cmp() builtin, or sorted(cmp=) parameter
SEMANTIC_CMP.fix_strategy: Replace __cmp__ with __lt__/__eq__/etc via functools.total_ordering; replace cmp() with (a > b) - (a < b); replace sorted(cmp=) with sorted(key=functools.cmp_to_key(...))

SEMANTIC_DIV.fix_strategy: Rename to __truediv__ for float division or __floordiv__ for integer division

SEMANTIC_INTEGER_DIVISION.description: / operator used for integer division (Py3 / always returns float)
SEMANTIC_INTEGER_DIVISION.fix_strategy: Replace / with // where integer division is intended; verify each case

SEMANTIC_LONG_TYPE.description: long() builtin or isinstance(x, long) type checks
SEMANTIC_LONG_TYPE.fix_strategy: Replace long with int; remove isinstance checks against long; int handles arbitrary precision in Py3

SEMANTIC_BASESTRING.description: basestring type (common base of str and unicode, removed in Py3)
SEMANTIC_BASESTRING.fix_strategy: Replace isinstance(x, basestring) with isinstance(x, str)

SEMANTIC_UNICODE_TYPE.description: unicode() builtin or isinstance(x, unicode) type checks
SEMANTIC_UNICODE_TYPE.fix_strategy: Replace unicode with str; Py3 str is always Unicode. Replace unicode() calls with str()

SEMANTIC_DICT_ITERITEMS.description: dict.iteritems(), dict.iterkeys(), dict.itervalues() methods (removed in Py3)

SEMANTIC_DICT_VIEWKEYS.description: dict.viewkeys(), dict.viewvalues(), dict.viewitems() methods (removed in Py3)

SEMANTIC_DICT_HAS_KEY.fix_strategy: Replace d.has_key(k) with k in d

SEMANTIC_XRANGE.description: xrange() builtin (removed in Py3, range() is lazy in Py3)

SEMANTIC_RAW_INPUT.description: raw_input() builtin (renamed to input() in Py3)

SEMANTIC_REDUCE.description: reduce() builtin (moved to functools.reduce in Py3)
SEMANTIC_REDUCE.fix_strategy: Add from functools import reduce or use functools.reduce()

SEMANTIC_INTERN.description: intern() builtin (moved to sys.intern in Py3)

SEMANTIC_BUFFER.description: buffer() builtin (replaced by memoryview() in Py3)

SEMANTIC_ITERATOR_NEXT.description: iterator.next() method call (renamed to next(iterator) in Py3)

SEMANTIC_ITERTOOLS_IZIP.fix_strategy: Replace itertools.izip with zip, itertools.imap with map, itertools.ifilter with filter

SEMANTIC_MAP_FILTER_LIST.description: map()/filter() used where list result is expected (Py3 returns iterators)
SEMANTIC_MAP_FILTER_LIST.fix_strategy: Wrap in list() if list is needed: list(map(...)), list(filter(...)); or use list comprehensions

IMPORT_REMOVED_STDLIB.description: Imports of removed or renamed standard library modules
IMPORT_REMOVED_STDLIB.fix_strategy: Update to Py3 module names: ConfigParser->configparser, Queue->queue, cPickle->pickle, StringIO->io.StringIO, cStringIO->io.StringIO, httplib->http.client, urllib->urllib.parse/urllib.request, urllib2->urllib.request, xmlrpclib->xmlrpc.client, thread->_thread/threading, commands->subprocess, __builtin__->builtins, copy_reg->copyreg, repr->reprlib, BaseHTTPServer->http.server, Cookie->http.cookies, cookielib->http.cookiejar, imp->importlib, md5/sha->hashlib, sets->set builtin

IMPORT_DISTUTILS.description: from distutils.core import setup (distutils removed in Python 3.12)
IMPORT_DISTUTILS.fix_strategy: Migrate to setuptools or pyproject.toml based build system; distutils was deprecated in 3.10 and removed in 3.12

SEMANTIC_FILE_BUILTIN.description: file() builtin used as constructor (removed in Py3)

SEMANTIC_SYS_MAXINT.description: sys.maxint attribute (removed in Py3, use sys.maxsize)

SEMANTIC_SETS_MODULE.description: sets.Set from the 'sets' module (module removed in Py3)

SEMANTIC_OPERATOR_REMOVED.description: Removed operator module functions: isCallable, isSequenceType, isMappingType, sequenceIncludes
SEMANTIC_OPERATOR_REMOVED.fix_strategy: Replace operator.isCallable with callable(), operator.isSequenceType with isinstance(x, collections.abc.Sequence), operator.isMappingType with isinstance(x, collections.abc.Mapping), operator.sequenceIncludes with operator.contains

SEMANTIC_FUNC_ATTRS.description: func_name, func_defaults, func_closure attributes (renamed in Py3)
SEMANTIC_FUNC_ATTRS.fix_strategy: Replace func_name with __name__, func_defaults with __defaults__, func_closure with __closure__

SEMANTIC_METHOD_ATTRS.description: im_func, im_self, im_class bound method attributes (renamed in Py3)
SEMANTIC_METHOD_ATTRS.fix_strategy: Replace im_func with __func__, im_self with __self__; im_class has no direct replacement (use type(method.__self__))

SEMANTIC_RELOAD.description: reload() builtin (moved to importlib.reload in Py3)

SEMANTIC_IMP_MODULE.description: imp module usage (deprecated since 3.4, use importlib)
SEMANTIC_IMP_MODULE.fix_strategy: Replace imp.find_module/load_module with importlib.import_module or importlib.util.spec_from_file_location

SEMANTIC_OS_GETCWDU.description: os.getcwdu() (removed in Py3, os.getcwd() returns str/unicode in Py3)

SEMANTIC_JSON_ENCODING_PARAM.fix_strategy: Remove the encoding= parameter; ensure input is str or properly decoded bytes before calling json.loads

SEMANTIC_CPICKLE.description: cPickle module usage (merged into pickle in Py3)
SEMANTIC_CPICKLE.fix_strategy: Replace import cPickle with import pickle; the C accelerator is used automatically in Py3

SEMANTIC_COPY_REG.description: copy_reg module (renamed to copyreg in Py3)
SEMANTIC_COPY_REG.fix_strategy: Replace import copy_reg with import copyreg

SEMANTIC_MD5_SHA_MODULES.description: md5.new() and sha.new() standalone modules (removed in Py3)
SEMANTIC_MD5_SHA_MODULES.fix_strategy: Replace md5.new(data) with hashlib.md5(data) and sha.new(data) with hashlib.sha1(data)

SEMANTIC_STANDARD_ERROR.description: StandardError base exception class (removed in Py3)

SEMANTIC_IMPLICIT_RELATIVE_IMPORT.description: Implicit relative imports (from module import X without leading dot)
SEMANTIC_IMPLICIT_RELATIVE_IMPORT.fix_strategy: Add leading dot for relative imports: from .module import X; or use absolute imports with full package path

SEMANTIC_TUPLE_PARAM_UNPACK.description: Tuple parameter unpacking in function definitions (PEP 3113, removed in Py3)
SEMANTIC_TUPLE_PARAM_UNPACK.fix_strategy: Replace def f((a, b)): with def f(ab): a, b = ab

SEMANTIC_XREADLINES.description: file.xreadlines() method (removed in Py3, iterate file directly)
SEMANTIC_XREADLINES.fix_strategy: Replace f.xreadlines() with iterating the file object directly: for line in f:

SEMANTIC_TYPES_INSTANCETYPE.description: types.InstanceType (removed in Py3, old-style classes no longer exist)
SEMANTIC_TYPES_INSTANCETYPE.fix_strategy: Remove InstanceType checks; all classes are new-style in Py3

DATA_ENCODING_BOUNDARY.description: str/bytes/unicode confusion at I/O boundaries where Py2 str and Py3 str differ fundamentally
DATA_ENCODING_BOUNDARY.fix_strategy: Audit all I/O boundaries; use bytes for binary protocols and str for text; add explicit .encode()/.decode() at boundaries; this requires careful per-case analysis
DATA_ENCODING_BOUNDARY.note: Pervasive across io_protocols/, data_processing/, and storage/ packages. Not counted as discrete occurrences; flagged as a cross-cutting concern requiring manual audit of every I/O boundary.

DATA_SOCKET_RECV.description: Socket recv() returns bytes in Py3 but str in Py2; code treats result as str
DATA_SOCKET_RECV.fix_strategy: Add .decode() after recv() for text protocols, or handle as bytes for binary protocols

DATA_STRUCT_MIXED.description: struct.pack/unpack results mixed with string operations (bytes vs str confusion)
DATA_STRUCT_MIXED.fix_strategy: Ensure struct operations work with bytes; do not concatenate struct output with str; use bytes literals (b'...') where appropriate
DATA_STRUCT_MIXED.note: Pervasive in io_protocols/ package. Not counted as discrete occurrences; requires per-file audit of struct usage patterns in modbus_client.py, mqtt_listener.py, serial_sensor.py, and file_store.py.

DATA_ORD_ON_BYTES.description: ord() called on bytes indexing result (Py3 bytes[i] already returns int, making ord() redundant/broken)
DATA_ORD_ON_BYTES.fix_strategy: Remove ord() wrapper when indexing bytes objects; bytes[i] returns int in Py3. For Py2/3 compat: use indexing directly on bytes

Long integer literals with L suffix

iterator.next() method call instead of next(iterator)
unicode type references and string_types/text_type definitions
import ConfigParser, import Queue, import cPickle, from cStringIO, from StringIO
